result.execSummary:
The defendant Blerim Rrahmani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine and costs to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 3-15-2016 with payment plan fee of $15.00.
Alternate 8 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blerim Rrahmani

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Blerim Rrahmani did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court orders the following:  Fine $299.00 and  Domestic Abuse Surcharge $100.00 and to be paid  at the rate of $50.00 a month commencing 03/15/2015 or alternate of 8 days jail.
Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Blerim Rrahmani did not appear.  Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for plea and sentencing for her client to complete his counseling. State has no objections. Defense present bail arguments. Victim speaks. Court grants the modification.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is about half thru his counseling and defendant counsel is requesting adjournmnet for plea and sentencing. Court adjourns.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for the defendant to begin his counseling in Milwaukee. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has offer to amend charge to a county ordinance with DV counseling.  Defense expects it will be a 15-20 week program.  Court will set a further proceedings date to check on the defendant's progress.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant can return to the residence one time with a police officer present to obtain his personal property.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Blerim Rrahmani in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
